ygData.subject: Re: RE: anaglyphs
ygData.msgSnippet: I don t think it is the 3D glasses, but rather the pictures that are meant to be looked at through the glasses. Brillian ... From: cleocrazy
ygData.messageBody:
I don't think it is the 3D glasses, but rather the pictures that are meant
to be looked at through the glasses.

Brillian


----- Original Message -----
From: cleocrazy <cleocrazy@...>
To: <EQ_Tinkering@onelist.com>
Sent: Monday, February 07, 2000 9:27 PM
Subject: [EQ_Tinkering] RE: anaglyphs


> From: "cleocrazy" <cleocrazy@...>
>
> what the definition means is 3D glasses. red on the left, blue
(contrasts
> red) on the right :)
>
> of course, the infra/ultra vision goggles are close enough to that
> principal. nice work. i never thought to look up the word.
>
> this leaves us with a few possibilities. the one which i think may be
most
> possible is that this is groundwork, and the actual product made from this
> is not as of yet in game. keep it up gnomes! i'm soon to be 16th and i'm
> eager to help with the knowledge quest!
>
> Xiltik
> 15 Rogue
> E'ci
>
> <<<

> Gimbelstan's journal mentions that the Gemcutter is used to make pearl
> anaglyphs.
>
> 2 : a stereoscopic motion or still picture in which the right component of
a
> composite image usually red in color is superposed on the left component
in
> a contrasting color to produce a three-dimensional effect when viewed
> through correspondingly colored filters in the form of spectacles
